collectionMetadata.name: Pupils Per Teacher in Primary And Secondary Schools
collectionMetadata.description:
1) Figures for secondary schools include students and teachers in Government, Government-Aided, Independent, Specialised Independent, Specialised schools.
2) The ratio of students to teaching staff or what is known as the Pupil-Teacher Ratio (PTR), is the number of primary/secondary students divided by the number of teachers in primary/secondary schools.

datasetMetadata.name: Pupils Per Teacher in Secondary Schools
datasetMetadata.description:
(1) Figures for secondary schools include students and teachers in Government, Government-aided, Independent, Specialised Independent and Specialised schools.

(2) The ratio of students to teaching staff or what is known as the Pupil-Teacher Ratio (PTR), is the number of secondary students divided by the number of teachers in secondary schools.

datasetMetadata.name: Pupils Per Teacher in Primary Schools
datasetMetadata.description: (1) The ratio of students to teaching staff or what is known as the Pupil-Teacher Ratio (PTR), is the number of primary students divided by the number of teachers in primary schools.
